title: Morty and the Mousetown Gazette
subtle: Fantasy (fiction), 1,834 words, Level T (Grade 3), Lexile 860L, Fiction Series
description: Morty Mouse couldn't believe he finally had a chance to become a newspaper carrier. His friend Ben asked him to cover his route for three days, and if Morty did a good job, he just might get his own job. Will Morty see his dream of being a newspaper carrier become a reality? Students will learn about the importance of dependability and honesty as Morty discovers if he is ready for the responsibility of having a job. Illustrations support the text.
meta: convince, deadline, delivery, diligence, familiar, funeral, mistake, refund, responsibility, route, shrill, tip
Use the reading strategy of making, revising, and confirming predictions to understand the text
Cause and Effect : Understand and identify cause-and-effect relationships
Compound Sentences : Identify compound sentences used in text

Promote higher-order thinking for small groups
or whole class
